node.title: Rescue underway of motorist trapped in rising floodwaters of Todd River
node.alt: Drone footage of the Todd River breaking its banks.
node.description: Northern Territory Emergency Services are attempting to rescue a manÂ trapped by rising floodwaters after his car was swept off the Wills Terrace causeway in Alice Springs' Todd River.
node.content:
["A man has been trapped in the rapidly flowing Todd River after his car was swept off the Wills Terrace causeway earlier today.", "Ian Carlton Regional manager for Northern Territory emergency services said the man had\u00a0been there for several hours.", "\"A\u00a0very unfortunate incident this morning of someone entering the floodwaters and\u00a0potentially paying the price and having to be rescued,\" Mr Carlton said.", "\"So we try not to get them to enter the water. They've thrown a life jacket to him. They will\u00a0now try with ropes to get a rope to him or poles where he's able to reach it and retrieve him.\"", "NT Police superintendent Antony Deutrom said a boat had\u00a0been deployed in the rescue effort.\u00a0The ABC understands that it was borrowed from a member of the public.", "\"The boat [is] as a contingency to assist in the rescue. It\u00a0is tethered to the bridge without a motor and if required will be used to assist with the extraction,\" Superintendent Deutrom\u00a0said.", "Northern Territory Fire Rescue Service have closed the road\u00a0and\u00a0St. John ambulance\u00a0are on stand-by\u00a0to assist.", "Mr Carlton said\u00a0the Todd River in flood was\u00a0dramatically different from yesterday when it was just a little trickle.", "", "
Motorist trapped by rising flood waters on the Todd River.\u00a0
", "\"With the 80\u201390 mm of rain that we've had overnight in the upper catchment, it's coming down and it's flowing really fast,\" Mr Carlton said.", "\"We're expecting a little bit more rain and although it's easing\u00a0at times, there's potential for more rain and thunderstorms to develop over the afternoon.", "\"With the amount of rain that we've had up in the top end of the catchment, it's currently sitting at around 2\u00a0metres but expected to peak sometime today at around the moderate flood level,\" he said.", "For emergency help in floods, storms or cyclones call NT Emergency Services on 132 500."]
